intro: Eschscholzia biternata, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, with a hairy surface. Eschscholzia biternata is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is often found along roadsides and in meadows.
